title: file
description: The File Object represents the properties of a file.

allOf.title: cyber-observable-core
allOf.description: Common properties and behavior across all Cyber Observable Objects.

type.description: Indicates that this object is an Observable Object. The value of this property MUST be a valid Observable Object type name, but to allow for custom objects this has been removed from the schema.

spec_version.description: The version of the STIX specification used to represent the content in this cyber-observable.

object_marking_refs.description: The list of marking-definition objects to be applied to this object.

items.title: identifier
items.description: Represents identifiers across the CTI specifications. The format consists of the name of the top-level object being identified, followed by two dashes (--), followed by a UUIDv4.

granular_markings.description: The set of granular markings that apply to this object.

items.title: granular-marking
items.description: The granular-marking type defines how the list of marking-definition objects referenced by the marking_refs property to apply to a set of content identified by the list of selectors in the selectors property.

selectors.description: A list of selectors for content contained within the STIX object in which this property appears.

lang.description: Identifies the language of the text identified by this marking.

allOf.title: identifier
allOf.description: Represents identifiers across the CTI specifications. The format consists of the name of the top-level object being identified, followed by two dashes (--), followed by a UUIDv4.
The marking_ref property specifies the ID of the marking-definition object that describes the marking.

defanged.description: Defines whether or not the data contained within the object has been defanged.

id.title: identifier
id.description: Represents identifiers across the CTI specifications. The format consists of the name of the top-level object being identified, followed by two dashes (--), followed by a UUIDv4.

extensions.description: Specifies any extensions of the object, as a dictionary.

allOf.title: properties
allOf.description: Rules for custom properties

^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_bin$.title: binary
^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_bin$.description: The ​binary data type represents a sequence of bytes. In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, for all properties that use the binary type, the property name MUST end with '_bin'. The JSON MTI serialization represents this as a base64-­encoded string as specified in RFC4648​. Other serializations SHOULD use a native binary type, if available.

^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_hex$.title: hex
^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_hex$.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

allOf.title: properties
allOf.description: Rules for custom properties

^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_bin$.title: binary
^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_bin$.description: The ​binary data type represents a sequence of bytes. In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, for all properties that use the binary type, the property name MUST end with '_bin'. The JSON MTI serialization represents this as a base64-­encoded string as specified in RFC4648​. Other serializations SHOULD use a native binary type, if available.

^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_hex$.title: hex
^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_hex$.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

allOf.title: properties
allOf.description: Rules for custom properties

^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_bin$.title: binary
^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_bin$.description: The ​binary data type represents a sequence of bytes. In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, for all properties that use the binary type, the property name MUST end with '_bin'. The JSON MTI serialization represents this as a base64-­encoded string as specified in RFC4648​. Other serializations SHOULD use a native binary type, if available.

^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_hex$.title: hex
^[a-z][a-z0-9_]{0,245}_hex$.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

type.description: The value of this property MUST be `file`.

extensions.description: The File Object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own. Extensions: ntfs-ext, raster-image-ext, pdf-ext, archive-ext, windows-pebinary-ext

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^ntfs-ext$.description: The NTFS file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to the storage of the file on the NTFS file system.

sid.description: Specifies the security ID (SID) value assigned to the file.

alternate_data_streams.description: Specifies a list of NTFS alternate data streams that exist for the file.

name.description: Specifies the name of the alternate data stream.

hashes.description: Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the data contained in the alternate data stream.
hashes.title: hashes

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA-1 (secure-hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

^SSDEEP$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

^TLSH$.description: Specifies the TLSH locality-sensitive hashing algorithm.

size.description: Specifies the size of the alternate data stream, in bytes, as a non-negative integer.

^raster-image-ext$.description: The Raster Image file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to image files.

image_height.description: Specifies the height of the image in the image file, in pixels.

image_width.description: Specifies the width of the image in the image file, in pixels.

bits_per_pixel.description: Specifies the sum of bits used for each color channel in the image in the image file, and thus the total number of pixels used for expressing the color depth of the image.

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

exif_tags.description: Specifies the set of EXIF tags found in the image file, as a dictionary. Each key/value pair in the dictionary represents the name/value of a single EXIF tag.

^pdf-ext$.description: The PDF file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to PDF files.

version.description: Specifies the decimal version number of the string from the PDF header that specifies the version of the PDF specification to which the PDF file conforms. E.g., '1.4'.

is_optimized.description: Specifies whether the PDF file has been optimized.

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

document_info_dict.description: Specifies details of the PDF document information dictionary (DID), which includes properties like the document creation data and producer, as a dictionary.

pdfid0.description: Specifies the first file identifier found for the PDF file.

pdfid1.description: Specifies the second file identifier found for the PDF file.

^archive-ext$.description: The Archive File extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to archive files.

contains_refs.description: Specifies the files contained in the archive, as a reference to one or more other File Objects. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type file-object.

comment.description: Specifies a comment included as part of the archive file.

^windows-pebinary-ext$.description: The Windows PE Binary File extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to Windows portable executable (PE) files.

pe_type.description: Specifies the type of the PE binary. Open Vocabulary - windows-pebinary-type-ov

imphash.description: Specifies the special import hash, or 'imphash', calculated for the PE Binary based on its imported libraries and functions.

machine_hex.title: hex
machine_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

number_of_sections.description: Specifies the number of sections in the PE binary, as a non-negative integer.

time_date_stamp.description: Specifies the time when the PE binary was created.  The timestamp value MUST BE precise to the second.

allOf.title: timestamp
allOf.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.

pointer_to_symbol_table_hex.title: hex
pointer_to_symbol_table_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

number_of_symbols.description: Specifies the number of entries in the symbol table of the PE binary, as a non-negative integer.

size_of_optional_header.description: Specifies the size of the optional header of the PE binary.

characteristics_hex.title: hex
characteristics_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

file_header_hashes.description: Specifies any hashes that were computed for the file header.
file_header_hashes.title: hashes

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA-1 (secure-hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

^SSDEEP$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

^TLSH$.description: Specifies the TLSH locality-sensitive hashing algorithm.

optional_header.description: Specifies the PE optional header of the PE binary.

magic_hex.title: hex
magic_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

major_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker major version number.

minor_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker minor version number.

size_of_code.description: Specifies the size of the code (text) section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

size_of_initialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the initialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

size_of_uninitialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the uninitialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

address_of_entry_point.description: Specifies the address of the entry point relative to the image base when the executable is loaded into memory.

base_of_code.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-code section when it is loaded into memory.

base_of_data.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-data section when it is loaded into memory.

image_base.description: Specifies the preferred address of the first byte of the image when loaded into memory.

section_alignment.description: Specifies the alignment (in bytes) of PE sections when they are loaded into memory.

file_alignment.description: Specifies the factor (in bytes) that is used to align the raw data of sections in the image file.

major_os_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the required operating system.

minor_os_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the required operating system.

major_image_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the image.

minor_image_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the image.

major_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the subsystem.

minor_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the subsystem.

win32_version_value_hex.title: hex
win32_version_value_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

size_of_image.description: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the image, including all headers, as the image is loaded in memory.

size_of_headers.description: Specifies the combined size of the MS-DOS, PE header, and section headers, rounded up a multiple of the value specified in the file_alignment header.

checksum_hex.title: hex
checksum_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

subsystem_hex.title: hex
subsystem_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

dll_characteristics_hex.title: hex
dll_characteristics_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

size_of_stack_reserve.description: Specifies the size of the stack to reserve

size_of_stack_commit.description: Specifies the size of the stack to commit.

size_of_heap_reserve.description: Specifies the size of the local heap space to reserve.

size_of_heap_commit.description: Specifies the size of the local heap space to commit.

loader_flags_hex.title: hex
loader_flags_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

number_of_rva_and_sizes.description: Specifies the number of data-directory entries in the remainder of the optional header.

hashes.description: Specifies any hashes that were computed for the optional header.
hashes.title: hashes

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA-1 (secure-hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

^SSDEEP$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

^TLSH$.description: Specifies the TLSH locality-sensitive hashing algorithm.

sections.description: Specifies metadata about the sections in the PE file.

items.description: The PE Section type specifies metadata about a PE file section.

name.description: Specifies the name of the section.

size.description: Specifies the size of the section, in bytes.

entropy.description: Specifies the calculated entropy for the section, as calculated using the Shannon algorithm.

hashes.description: Specifies any hashes computed over the section.
hashes.title: hashes

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA-1 (secure-hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

^SSDEEP$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

^TLSH$.description: Specifies the TLSH locality-sensitive hashing algorithm.

additionalProperties.title: dictionary
additionalProperties.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

hashes.description: Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the file.
hashes.title: hashes

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA-1 (secure-hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

^SSDEEP$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

^TLSH$.description: Specifies the TLSH locality-sensitive hashing algorithm.

size.description: Specifies the size of the file, in bytes, as a non-negative integer.

name.description: Specifies the name of the file.

name_enc.description: Specifies the observed encoding for the name of the file.

magic_number_hex.title: hex
magic_number_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

mime_type.description: Specifies the MIME type name specified for the file, e.g., 'application/msword'.

ctime.title: timestamp
ctime.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.

mtime.title: timestamp
mtime.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.

atime.title: timestamp
atime.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.

parent_directory_ref.description: Specifies the parent directory of the file, as a reference to a Directory Object.

contains_refs.description: Specifies a list of references to other Observable Objects contained within the file.

content_ref.description: Specifies the content of the file, represented as an Artifact Object.

allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

pe_type.description: Specifies the type of the PE binary. Open Vocabulary - windows-pebinary-type-ov

imphash.description: Specifies the special import hash, or 'imphash', calculated for the PE Binary based on its imported libraries and functions.

major_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker major version number.

size_of_code.description: Specifies the size of the code (text) section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

size_of_initialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the initialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

minor_image_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the image.

size_of_image.description: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the image, including all headers, as the image is loaded in memory.

size_of_headers.description: Specifies the combined size of the MS-DOS, PE header, and section headers, rounded up a multiple of the value specified in the file_alignment header.

checksum_hex.title: hex
checksum_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

subsystem_hex.title: hex
subsystem_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

dll_characteristics_hex.title: hex
dll_characteristics_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

size_of_stack_reserve.description: Specifies the size of the stack to reserve

size_of_stack_commit.description: Specifies the size of the stack to commit.

size_of_heap_reserve.description: Specifies the size of the local heap space to reserve.

size_of_heap_commit.description: Specifies the size of the local heap space to commit.

loader_flags_hex.title: hex
loader_flags_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

number_of_rva_and_sizes.description: Specifies the number of data-directory entries in the remainder of the optional header.

hashes.description: Specifies any hashes that were computed for the optional header.
hashes.title: hashes

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA-1 (secure-hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

^SSDEEP$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

^TLSH$.description: Specifies the TLSH locality-sensitive hashing algorithm.

sections.description: Specifies metadata about the sections in the PE file.

items.description: The PE Section type specifies metadata about a PE file section.

name.description: Specifies the name of the section.

size.description: Specifies the size of the section, in bytes.

entropy.description: Specifies the calculated entropy for the section, as calculated using the Shannon algorithm.

hashes.description: Specifies any hashes computed over the section.
hashes.title: hashes

allOf.title: dictionary
allOf.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA-1 (secure-hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA2 family).

^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

^SSDEEP$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

^TLSH$.description: Specifies the TLSH locality-sensitive hashing algorithm.

additionalProperties.title: dictionary
additionalProperties.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs

windows-pe-optional-header-type.description: The Windows PE Optional Header type represents the properties of the PE optional header.

magic_hex.title: hex
magic_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

major_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker major version number.

minor_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker minor version number.

size_of_code.description: Specifies the size of the code (text) section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

size_of_initialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the initialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

size_of_uninitialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the uninitialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

address_of_entry_point.description: Specifies the address of the entry point relative to the image base when the executable is loaded into memory.

base_of_code.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-code section when it is loaded into memory.

base_of_data.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-data section when it is loaded into memory.

image_base.description: Specifies the preferred address of the first byte of the image when loaded into memory.

section_alignment.description: Specifies the alignment (in bytes) of PE sections when they are loaded into memory.

file_alignment.description: Specifies the factor (in bytes) that is used to align the raw data of sections in the image file.

major_os_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the required operating system.

minor_os_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the required operating system.

major_image_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the image.

minor_image_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the image.

major_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the subsystem.

minor_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the subsystem.

win32_version_value_hex.title: hex
win32_version_value_hex.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

size_of_image.description: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the image, including all headers, as the image is loaded in memory.

size_of_headers.description: Specifies the combined size of the MS-DOS, PE header, and section headers, rounded up a multiple of the value specified in the file_alignment header.
